isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - DISASSEMBLY - SPINDLE YOKE REMOVAL

step1.para: Perform Hub, Drum and Wheel Bearing Removal, also Brake and Wheel Spindle Removal as previously described.

Disconnect tie rod end(s) and drag link. Remove the cotter pin, castle nut, and then while prying between the tie rod end and steering arm, sharply strike side of steering arm radially to end of tie rod bend tapered stud.
Remove four capscrews ( Figure 21) that retain the universal joint cross and bearing to the outer drive yoke.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Removing Universal Joint Cross Bolts

step1.para: Support the spindle yoke while removing the four capscrews at the upper kingpin bracket (refer to Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Removing Bolts at Upper King Pin Bracket

step1.para: Lower the spindle yoke and at the same time rotate the top outward ( Figure 23). This should allow the kingpin ball to come out of its socket in the suspension yoke. The spindle yoke can then be moved away from the axle.
